request.description:
### Get Comments

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of comments.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

The response will include an array of comment objects, each containing information about a specific comment.

response.name: get comments by post | no post id
get comment by id | not found
get comment by id | bad id

request.description: This endpoint retrieves the user's comments by their ID. The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the structure of the data returned.

response.name: get comments by user | no comments

request.description: The endpoint allows the user to create a new comment by sending an HTTP POST request to the specified URL. Upon successful execution, the response will be in the form of a JSON schema, detailing the structure of the response data.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new user by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the following parameters in the raw request body:

- `username` (string): The username of the new user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the new user.
    
- `password` (string): The password for the new user.
    
- `type` (string): The type of user, e.g., admin, regular, etc.
    

The response will include the details of the newly created user, such as user ID, username, email, and type.

response.name: Create User netinkamas user tipas
Create User empty field

request.description:
This endpoint allows updating user information by making an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL with the user ID in the path parameter. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body, containing the updated user details such as username, email, password, and type.

### Request Body

- `username` (string): The updated username for the user.
    
- `email` (string): The updated email address for the user.
    
- `password` (string): The updated password for the user.
    
- `type` (string): The updated user type, e.g., admin, regular, etc.
    

### Response

The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the updated user information. The schema will include the properties for the user's details, such as username, email, and type, along with any additional information specific to the API implementation.

Example JSON schema:

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "username": { "type": "string" },
    "email": { "type": "string", "format": "email" },
    "password": { "type": "string" },
    "type": { "type": "string" }
    // Additional properties specific to the API implementation
  }
}

 ```

# Delete User

This endpoint is used to delete a specific user by providing the user ID in the URL.

## Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: {{URL}}/users/67101717abfc33ded48ea00d
    

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

## Response

### 200 OK

The response will be empty if the user is successfully deleted.

### JSON Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {},
  "additionalProperties": false
}

 ```

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific user identified by their unique ID. The request does not require a request body, and the user ID is included in the URL path. Upon a successful request, the response will include the user's details such as their name, email, and other relevant information.

response.name: get User by Id | nera tokio userio
get User by Id | randa useri
get User by Id | netinkamas id formattas
get User by Id | user not found

request.description:
### Add Tractor

This endpoint allows you to add a new tractor to the system.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): The name of the tractor.
    
- `description` (string, required): A description of the tractor.
    
- `created_by` (string, required): The ID of the user who created the tractor.
    

#### Response

The response will contain the status of the request, along with any relevant data or error messages.

response.name: create Tractor | neranda/ negauna tinkamo userio

request.description: This endpoint allows the user to update information about tractors. Upon a successful request, the response will be a JSON schema detailing the structure of the updated tractor data.

response.name: update tractor | empty fields

request.description: This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of tractors. The response for this request can be documented as a JSON schema to describe the structure of the data returned.

### GET /tractors/

This endpoint retrieves a list of tractors.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `tractorId` (string): The unique identifier for the tractor.
- `model` (string): The model of the tractor.
- `year` (integer): The manufacturing year of the tractor.
- `manufacturer` (string): The manufacturer of the tractor.

Example response:
```json
{
  "tractorId": "abc123",
  "model": "Tractor Model",
  "year": 2022,
  "manufacturer": "Tractor Manufacturer"
}
```

response.name: Get tractor by id | bad id

request.description:
### Delete Tractor

This endpoint is used to delete a tractor from the system.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- `status` (number): The HTTP status code of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message confirming the deletion of the tractor.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of posts. The request does not include a request body, as it is a simple GET request. The response will include an array of post objects, each containing details such as post ID, title, body, and user ID.

request.description:
### Get Post by ID
This endpoint retrieves a specific post by its unique ID.

#### Request
- Method: GET
- URL: `{{URL}}/posts/id`

#### Response
The response will include the details of the post identified by the provided ID.

request.description:
### Add a New Post

This endpoint allows the user to add a new post by sending an HTTP POST request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body
- `title` (text): The title of the post.
- `content` (text): The content of the post.

#### Response
Upon successful creation of the post, the response will include the details of the newly created post, including the unique identifier, title, and content.

request.description:
### Update Post
This endpoint is used to update a specific post by providing the post ID in the URL.

#### Request Body
- `title` (text): The updated title of the post.
- `content` (text): The updated content of the post.

#### Response
The response will include the updated details of the post, including the new title and content.

request.description:
### Delete Post by ID

This endpoint is used to delete a specific post by its ID.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `{{URL}}/posts/id`
    

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema, which will be returned upon successful deletion of the post.
